analysis

Class IntegralApproximator

  • java.lang.Object
    • analysis.IntegralApproximator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FunctionIntf

    public class IntegralApproximator
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionIntf
    Performs numerical integration in one dimension using the Adaptive Simpson Procedure.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntegralApproximator

        public IntegralApproximator(FunctionIntf f,
                    java.util.Hashtable params)
        public constructor.
        Parameters:
        f - FunctionIntf
        params - Hashtable may contain the following pairs: <"integralapproximator.eps", Double eps> if present specifies the required precision, default is 1.e-6, <"integralapproximator.levelmax", Integer level> if present specifies the maximum level of recursion in the Simpson method, default is Integer.MAX_VALUE

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public double eval(java.lang.Object x,
          java.util.Hashtable params)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        computes the integral with respect to the i-th variable of the function provided in the constructor, from a lower limit a defined in the params Hashtable, to the specified value x_i in the vector x.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface FunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        x - Object a VectorIntf or double[] object.
        params - Hashtable must contain at least a pair of the form <"integralapproximator.a", Double a> indicating the lower limit of integration and a pair of the form <"integralapproximator.integrandvarindex", Integer i> indicating the variable index for the integration (must range in [0,x.length-1] if is a double[] or in [0,x.getNumCoords()-1] if x is a VectorIntf object). Additionally, params must contain whatever parameters are needed so that the function f passed in the constructor needs in order to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the two pairs required in params Hashtable are not present, or if the integration could not be carried out with the required precision.

             java.util.Hashtable p)
                throws IntegrationException,

        Throws:
